com.telekom.m2m.cot.restsdk.smartrest

Class SmartCepConnector

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.telekom.m2m.cot.restsdk.smartrest.SmartCepConnector
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Runnable

    public class SmartCepConnector
extends Object
implements Runnable
    The SmartCepConnector handles subscriptions and holds the connection to the CEP notification service.
    It passes on notifications to SmartListeners.
    Basic usage is like this:
    • store at least one SmartResponseTemplate, that can extract data from the notifications that you are interested in.
    • call subscribe(String, Set) to subscribe to a channel.
    • extend SmartListener and do something with SmartNotifications passed to SmartListener.onNotification(SmartNotification).
    • add the SmartListener via addListener(SmartListener).
    • call connect() to establish the connection and start the background polling thread.

    See SmartCepConnectorTest and SmartRestRealTimeIT for examples.

    • Constructor Detail

      • SmartCepConnector

        public SmartCepConnector(CloudOfThingsRestClient cloudOfThingsRestClient,
                         String xId)
        Construct a new SmartCepConnector with a default X-Id. That Id determines which response templates will be used.
        Additional X-Ids can be specified for each subscription.
        Parameters:
        cloudOfThingsRestClient - the client to use for connection to the cloud
        xId - default X-Id for all requests. Additional X-Ids are possible per subscription.

    • Method Detail

      • subscribe

        public void subscribe(String channel,
                      Set<String> additionalXIds)
        Subscribe to a notification channel. Will take effect immediately, even for currently running connect requests.
        Subscribing to the same channel twice will just add any additional X-Ids.
        Parameters:
        channel - the name of the channel. No wildcards are allowed for SmartREST.
        additionalXIds - additionalXIds that are to be registered for this channel.

      • unsubscribe

        public void unsubscribe(String channel)
        Unsubscribe from a channel. Will take effect immediately, even for currently running connect requests.
        Parameters:
        channel - the name of the channel.

      • addListener

        public void addListener(SmartListener listener)
        Add a SmartListener that will from then on be called for all the notifications that this connector receives.
        Adding the same listener multiple times has no additional effect.
        Parameters:
        listener - the SmartListener that shall receive notifications from this connector

      • removeListener

        public void removeListener(SmartListener listener)
        Remove a previously registered SmartListener.
        Trying to remove a listener that doesn't exist is ok.
        Parameters:
        listener - the SmartListener to remove

      • connect

        public void connect()
        Connect to the cloud server and start the asynchronous polling loop.
        To stop it call disconnect().

        The connector doesn't stop on most errors. There should probably be a SmartListener which can handle errors and trigger a disconnect, if necessary.

        This convenience method should be sufficient for most simple cases. If not, then you can extend the this class and build your own connection handling using the protected do*-methods.

      • disconnect

        public void disconnect()
        Break the polling loop and disconnect from the cloud server. Will try to interrupt the polling thread too.

      • getClientId

        public String getClientId()
        Get the clientId that was assigned by the server during handshake.
        Returns:
        the clientId or null, if we are not currently connected.

      • isConnected

        public boolean isConnected()
        Whether there is currently a polling thread connected to the server.
        Returns:
        true = yes; false = no

      • getTimeout

        public int getTimeout()
        The current read timeout.
        Returns:
        the timeout in milliseconds

      • setTimeout

        public void setTimeout(int timeout)
        Set the read timeout for the polling connect request.
        Can also be overwritten by advice messages sent from the server while the connector is connected.
        Default is .
        Parameters:
        timeout - the timeout in milliseconds

      • getInterval

        public int getInterval()
        The current interval, which is the time that the polling thread waits before it reconnects, after receiving a response.
        Returns:
        the waiting interval in milliseconds

      • setInterval

        public void setInterval(int interval)
        Set the time that the polling thread waits before it reconnects, after receiving a response.
        Can also be overwritten by advice messages sent from the server while the connector is connected.
        Default is .
        Parameters:
        interval - the waiting interval in milliseconds

      • run

        public void run()
        Don't call this method. It will be called by the system when the polling thread is started. Use connect() instead.
        Specified by:
        run in interface Runnable

      • doConnect

        protected String[] doConnect()

      • doHandshake

        protected String doHandshake()

      • postInitialSubscriptions

        protected void postInitialSubscriptions()
        Post all the subscriptions that we have to the server. Necessary for reconnects and when there already were subscriptions before we were connected.

      • setTimeoutByAdvice

        protected void setTimeoutByAdvice(int timeout)
        Override this method if You don't want the server advice to automatically change the read timeout for the connect request.
        Parameters:
        timeout - the timeout, that the server recommended
